titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Birmingham United Church of Christ Records, 1843-1977 AIS.1977.30
titlestmt.author: Archives Service Center Staff. Revisions occurred to the finding aid as a part of the encoding process on June 26, 2003.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-07-08 17:15:00 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Birmingham United Church of Christ Records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Birmingham United Church of Christ (Pittsburgh, Pa.)

did.abstract: The Birmingham United Church of Christ, originally chartered in June of 1846 as a United Evangelical Protestant Church, arose from the efforts of German-speaking residents living in the borough of Birmingham (now the South Side of Pittsburgh) who had worshipped at the Smithfield Street United Evangelical Protestant Church. The collection consists of ten reels of microfilm containing a constitution and journal, history, minute books, lists of members, memorial publications, baptismal, marriage, burial, and financial records from 1843-1977. Digital reproductions of the microfilm are available online.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Digital reproductions of the collection are available online.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Birmingham United Church of Christ, originally chartered in June of 1846 as a United Evangelical Protestant Church, arose from the efforts of German-speaking residents living in the borough of Birmingham (now the South Side of Pittsburgh) who had worshipped at the Smithfield Street United Evangelical Protestant Church. Throughout its history, the word 'Birmingham' has been retained in identifying this church. In 1924, the Birmingham church joined other United Evangelical Protestant Churches in the General Council of Congregational Churches. In 1964, the churches affiliated with the United Church of Christ.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Birmingham United Church of Christ Records consists of ten reels of microfilm containing a constitution and journal, history, minute books, lists of members, memorial publications, baptismal, marriage, burial, and financial records from 1843-1977. Also contained in the collection is a burial register that spans from 1902-1975 and cemetary deeds from 1896-1975. The church constitution and journal are in German and span from 1846-1889. The "official" church history dates from 1846-1926; there is also mention of an "unofficial" church history. The collection also has a 50th Year Jubilee Booklet, in German, that is dated 1896. The finanical records span from 1889-1967.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These records were microfilmed, with permission, by the Archives Service Center in 1977.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Original records retained by Birmingham United Church of Christ, 25 Carrick Ave., Pittsburgh, PA 15210.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Birmingham United Church of Christ Records, 1843-1977, AIS.1977.30, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Birmingham United Church of Christ Records, 1843-1977, AIS.1977.30, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

Previously cited as two separate collections: Birmingham United Church of Christ, Pittsburgh, Pa., Records, 1845-1976, AIS Micro 77:30a, Archives of Industrial Society, University Library System, University of Pittsburgh; and, Birmingham United Church of Christ, Pittsburgh, Pa., Records, 1843-1977, AIS Micro 77:30b, Archives of Industrial Society, University of Pittsburgh Libraries

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Archives Service Center Staff in 1977.

Revision and rearrangement for the encoded version of the finding aid provided by Jessica L. Marshall and Michael O'Malley on June 26, 2003. Information about the collection title and the controlled access terms was extracted from the MARC record in the University of Pittsburgh catalog Voyager ID number:1405398

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Permission for publication is given on behalf of the University of Pittsburgh as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission of the copyright holder, which must also be obtained.
